segment.source: UMDF Verifier Properties for Driver Package Projects
segment.target: UMDF Verifier Properties for Driver Package Projects

segment.source: Sets the properties for the UMDF Verifier on a test computer.
segment.target: Sets the properties for the UMDF Verifier on a test computer.

segment.source: You can use these settings when you build and deploy a driver to a test computer.
segment.target: You can use these settings when you build and deploy a driver to a test computer.

segment.source: For information about deployment, see Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 8.1) and Deploying a Driver to a Test Computer
segment.target: For information about deployment, see Provision a computer for driver deployment and testing (WDK 8.1) and Deploying a Driver to a Test Computer

segment.source: For information about debugging UMDF drivers, see How to Enable Debugging of a UMDF Driver and WDF Verifier Control Application.
segment.target: For information about debugging UMDF drivers, see How to Enable Debugging of a UMDF Driver and WDF Verifier Control Application.

segment.source: Setting UMDF Verifier properties for driver projects
segment.target: Setting UMDF Verifier properties for driver projects

segment.source: Open the property pages for your driver package.
segment.target: Open the property pages for your driver package.

segment.source: Right-click the driver package project in Solution Explorer and select Properties.
segment.target: Right-click the driver package project in Solution Explorer and select Properties.

segment.source: In the property pages for the driver package, click Configuration Properties, click Driver Install, and then click UMDF Verifier.
segment.target: In the property pages for the driver package, click Configuration Properties, click Driver Install, and then click UMDF Verifier.

segment.source: Select the Deploy UMDF Verifier option.
segment.target: Select the Deploy UMDF Verifier option.

segment.source: When this option is enabled (Yes), you can select the UMDF Verifier options to use on the test computer to verify a UMDF driver.
segment.target: When this option is enabled (Yes), you can select the UMDF Verifier options to use on the test computer to verify a UMDF driver.

segment.source: Option
segment.target: Option

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Deploy UMDF Verifier
segment.target: Deploy UMDF Verifier

segment.source: Enables the UMDF verifier settings on the test computer.
segment.target: Enables the UMDF verifier settings on the test computer.

segment.source: UMDF Service Names
segment.target: UMDF Service Names

segment.source: Specifies the service names of the UMDF drivers to monitor.
segment.target: Specifies the service names of the UMDF drivers to monitor.

segment.source: Enable Object Tracking
segment.target: Enable Object Tracking

segment.source: Tracks all created UMDF objects.
segment.target: Tracks all created UMDF objects.

segment.source: Enable Reference Count Tracking
segment.target: Enable Reference Count Tracking

segment.source: Tracks all UMDF object references.
segment.target: Tracks all UMDF object references.

segment.source: Maximum Restart Attempts
segment.target: Maximum Restart Attempts

segment.source: Maximum number of times UMDF will restart a failed host process.
segment.target: Maximum number of times UMDF will restart a failed host process.

segment.source: UMDF Logging level
segment.target: UMDF Logging level

segment.source: Specifies the amount of information logged by the UMDF verifier for the drivers it is hosting.
segment.target: Specifies the amount of information logged by the UMDF verifier for the drivers it is hosting.

segment.source: Only Critical and Fatal Errors Logs only critical and fatal errors.
segment.target: Only Critical and Fatal Errors Logs only critical and fatal errors.

segment.source: All Errors Logs all errors.
segment.target: All Errors Logs all errors.

segment.source: Warnings and all Errors Logs warnings and all errors.
segment.target: Warnings and all Errors Logs warnings and all errors.

segment.source: Informational events, Warnings and all Errors Logs informational events, warnings, and all errors.
segment.target: Informational events, Warnings and all Errors Logs informational events, warnings, and all errors.

segment.source: Verbose Output (All Events of any Sort) Logs all events.
segment.target: Verbose Output (All Events of any Sort) Logs all events.

segment.source: Log to Kernel Debugger
segment.target: Log to Kernel Debugger

segment.source: Logs verifier output to the kernel debugger.
segment.target: Logs verifier output to the kernel debugger.

segment.source: Break into Kernel Debugger
segment.target: Break into Kernel Debugger

segment.source: Break into kernel debugger when the UMDF host process fails.
segment.target: Break into kernel debugger when the UMDF host process fails.

segment.source: Attach to Kernel Debugger
segment.target: Attach to Kernel Debugger

segment.source: Attaches to the kernel debugger if no user-mode debugger is attached.
segment.target: Attaches to the kernel debugger if no user-mode debugger is attached.

segment.source: Timeout on Driver Load (sec)
segment.target: Timeout on Driver Load (sec)

segment.source: Specifies the time to wait (in seconds) before attaching the debugger after the driver loads.
segment.target: Specifies the time to wait (in seconds) before attaching the debugger after the driver loads.

segment.source: Timeout on Driver Start (sec)
segment.target: Timeout on Driver Start (sec)

segment.source: Specifies the time to wait (in seconds) before attaching the debugger after the driver starts.
segment.target: Specifies the time to wait (in seconds) before attaching the debugger after the driver starts.

segment.source: Verify at Current Level
segment.target: Verify at Current Level

segment.source: Verifies drivers built using earlier versions of the framework against current framework versions rules.
segment.target: Verifies drivers built using earlier versions of the framework against current framework versions rules.

segment.target: Related topics
